contradicting_spans: Faria, since their first acquaintance, had been on all points so rational and logical, so wonderfully sagacious, in fact, that he could not understand how so much wisdom on all points could be allied with madness.
reasoning: Contradiction (character): The character of Faria contradicts the claim that he was burned as a witch for spurning a nobleman and that this injustice fed his lifelong hatred of institutional rot.

analysis.claim_text: His sister was burned as a witch for spurning a nobleman; the injustice fed a lifelong hatred of institutional rot.

The injustice fed a lifelong hatred of institutional rot.
